metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The <marker> element is used to create a marker for the start, mid, and end of a <line> , <path> , <polyline> or <polygon> .
content.html: The <marker> element is used to create a marker for the start, mid, and end of a <line>, <path>, <polyline> or <polygon>.

content.text: All SVG markers are defined within a <defs> element. The <defs> element is short for "definitions", and contains definition of special elements (such as markers).
content.html: All SVG markers are defined within a <defs> element. The <defs> element is short for "definitions", and contains definition of special elements (such as markers).

content.text: The marker is attached to the shapes using the marker-start , marker-mid , and marker-end attributes.
content.html: The marker is attached to the shapes using the marker-start, marker-mid, and marker-end attributes.

content.text: The <marker> element has six basic attributes to position and set the size of the marker:
content.html: The <marker> element has six basic attributes to position and set the size of the marker:

content.code_html:
Attribute Description
id The unique id for the marker
markerHeight The height of the marker. Default is 3
markerWidth The width of the marker. Default is 3
refX The x position where the marker connects with the vertex. Default is 0
refY The y position where the marker connects with the vertex. Default is 0
orient The orientation of the marker relative to the shape it is attached to. Can be "auto", "auto-start-reverse" or an angle. Default is 0

content.text: A Line with Start and End Marker
The following example creates a line with a circular start marker and an arrowhead end marker:
content.html: The following example creates a line with a circular start marker and an arrowhead end marker:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<marker id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
  orient="auto">

id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
  orient="auto"

<line x1="10" y1="10" x2="300" y2="200" 
  stroke="red" stroke-width="3" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-end="url(#arrow)" 
  />

x1="10" y1="10" x2="300" y2="200" 
  stroke="red" stroke-width="3" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-end="url(#arrow)" 
  /

content.code:
<svg height="250" width="350" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<marker id="circle" markerWidth="8" markerHeight="8" refX="5" refY="5">
      
<circle cx="5" cy="5" r="3" fill="black" />
    </marker>
    
<marker id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
orient="auto">
      <path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 
z" fill="black" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  
<line x1="10" y1="10" x2="300" y2="200" 
stroke="red" stroke-width="3" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-end="url(#arrow)"
/>
</svg>

content.code_html:
<svg height="250" width="350" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <marker id="circle" markerWidth="8" markerHeight="8" refX="5" refY="5">
      <circle cx="5" cy="5" r="3" fill="black" />
    </marker>
    <marker id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" orient="auto">
      <path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 z" fill="black" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <line x1="10" y1="10" x2="300" y2="200" stroke="red" stroke-width="3" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-end="url(#arrow)" />
</svg>

content.text: The following example creates a polyline with a start marker, a mid marker and an end marker:
content.html: The following example creates a polyline with a start marker, a mid marker and an end marker:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<marker id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
  orient="auto">

id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
  orient="auto"

<polyline points="15,40 15,170 200,170" stroke="red" stroke-width="3" 
  fill="none" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-mid="url(#circle)" 
  marker-end="url(#arrow)" />

points="15,40 15,170 200,170" stroke="red" stroke-width="3" 
  fill="none" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-mid="url(#circle)" 
  marker-end="url(#arrow)" /

content.code:
<svg height="250" width="350" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    
<marker id="circle" markerWidth="8" markerHeight="8" refX="5" refY="5">
      
<circle cx="5" cy="5" r="2" fill="black" />
    </marker>
    
<marker id="arrow" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="10" refX="5" refY="5" 
orient="auto">
      <path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 
z" fill="black" />
    </marker>
  </defs>
  
<polyline points="15,40 15,170 200,170" stroke="red" stroke-width="3" 
fill="none" marker-start="url(#circle)" marker-mid="url(#circle)"
marker-end="url(#arrow)" />
</svg>
